title: Apply 30% opaque / 70% transparent glass surfaces across all panels (including Weather tab laundry panel)

requirements.text: Update the global glass surface utilities so that all UI “window/panel” surfaces using `.glass-surface` and `.glass-surface-strong` render at 30% opaque / 70% transparent (i.e., background alpha = 0.3) while preserving existing blur, borders, and shadows.

quotes: şeffaflık durumunu 30 opak - 70 şeffaf şeklinde yeniden düzenle

acceptanceCriteria: In `frontend/src/index.css`, `.glass-surface` and `.glass-surface-strong` use a background color alpha of 0.3 (70% transparent) rather than the previous value.
UI panels using these classes (e.g., header/footer, cards already using `glass-surface(-strong)`) visibly match the new transparency level in both light and dark modes.

requirements.text: Ensure the Laundry Drying panel in the Weather tab uses the same global glass surface styling (30% opaque / 70% transparent) as other windows/panels, instead of its current custom `bg-card/80` styling, so it visually matches the rest of the app.

quotes: çamaşır kurutma penceresinde neden bu opaklık durumu yok orada da istiyorum
hava durumu sekmesinde ondada aynı oranda olsun

acceptanceCriteria: `frontend/src/components/LaundryDryingRecommendation.tsx` no longer uses a hard-coded `bg-card/80 backdrop-blur-sm` surface that breaks the global transparency ratio.
The Laundry Drying panel background transparency matches other app windows/panels that use `.glass-surface` / `.glass-surface-strong` (30% opaque / 70% transparent).

requirements.text: Verify and enforce that all other major window/panel surfaces across all tabs (Weather, Farmer, Driver, Radar, Beach, and empty states) use the global glass utilities (or otherwise match the 30% opaque / 70% transparent ratio) so the transparency is consistent app-wide.
acceptanceCriteria: No prominent panel/window remains at a noticeably different opacity than the updated global ratio when navigating across tabs.
Any exceptions found during review are updated to use `.glass-surface` or `.glass-surface-strong` (or an equivalent 0.3 alpha surface) without changing layout or functionality.

constraints: Do not change the weather-based background images or their transition behavior; only adjust UI surfaces above the background (keep `BackgroundIllustration` behavior unchanged).
Do not edit files under `frontend/src/components/ui` (immutable UI components); apply changes via composition and app-level styles/components instead.
nonGoals: Adding new tabs, features, or changing weather data fetching/logic.
